thread.title: NYC granny beaten for telling woman to teach her kid manners
thread.title_full: NYC granny beaten for telling woman to teach her kid manners

author: Rocco Parascandola, Laura Dimon, Thomas Tracy
title: NYC granny beaten for telling woman to teach her kid manners
text:
Crazed Manhattan mother thrashes 71-year-woman for suggesting she teach her son manners NYC granny beaten for telling woman to teach her kid manners The 71-year-old woman was using an elevator at the 86th St. station when she encountered the menacing mom on Monday. (Yana Paskova/Getty Images)  23 PM 
Like mother, like child. 
An enraged mother pummeled a 71-year-old woman with her own cane on the Upper East Side, after the septuagenarian suggested the suspect teach her son some manners, authorities said Tuesday. 
The elderly woman was taking an elevator from the 86th St./2nd Ave. Q train station to street level about 2:10 p.m. Monday when a young woman and her 4-year-old boy rushed in as people were getting out, police said. 
“Maybe you should teach your child to wait till people come out of the elevator instead of trying to get in,” the senior told the young mom as they stepped inside, according to a police complaint. 
Seniors, man in wheelchair fall victim to mugging streak 
The scolding set the mom off — and she began pushing, punching and slapping the older woman — in full view of her child, officials said. 
After using her fists, the suspect grabbed the victim’s cane and bashed her with it, officials said. 
The senior was not seriously harmed, officials said. Cops are looking for the menacing mom.
